sentence.Network_en: He alleged that they had hired an assassin to dispose of him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他宣称他们已雇了刺客来除掉他。

sentence.Network_en: They have no way to dispose of the hazardous waste they produce.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们没有办法处理掉自己产生的有害废料。

sentence.Network_en: He doesn't know how to dispose of his spare time.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不知如何打发空余时间.

jx.jx_en_mean: To transfer or part with, as by giving or selling.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 赠送；卖掉：转让或分开，如通过给予或出售

jx.jx_en_mean: To get rid of; throw out.

lj.lj_ly: a despot who disposed of all his enemies, real or imagined.
lj.lj_ls: 暴君杀死了他所有的敌人，无论是真的还是想象的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French disposer, from Latin disponere 'arrange', influenced by dispositus 'arranged' and Old French poser 'to place'

means.word_mean: 1. give, sell, or transfer to another;
3. make receptive or willing towards an action or attitude or belief;

sentences.sentence: "Their language inclines us to believe them"
"Your education qualifies you for this job"

stems_affixes.word_buile: dispose安排+ed……的→任安排的→心甘情愿的
in不+disposed[adj.愿意的,想干的]→adj.不愿意的,身体不适的

pose放→n.姿势,姿态 v.造成,提出,摆姿势,佯装
propose[v.计划, 建议, 向……提议, 求[婚] v.打算, 求婚]+al表名词→n.提议,建议;求婚

Sentence.sentence: Drivers routinely collide with deer and there are so many dead bodies left by the side of the road that the town has made it a deal with a local pet cemetery to collect and dispose of the bodies.

means.word_mean: 去掉，舍弃，处理; 处置

sentences.en: He disposed his books on the shelves.
He was forced to dispose of his art treasures.
sentences.cn: 他被迫处理（舍弃）掉自己的艺术珍藏。

means.word_mean: 布置; 排列; 安排

sentences.en: They disposed troops along the river.

means.word_mean: 使愿意或准备做; 使倾向于; 使有意于; 使易于

sentences.en: His criminal records do not dispose me to trust him.
sentences.cn: 他的前科迫使我无法信任他。

jushi.english: The worker disposed his tools within easy reach.
jushi.chinese: 工人把工具放在顺手可取的地方。

jushi.english: She disposed the furniture in proper order.
jushi.chinese: 她将家具安放在适当的地方。

jushi.english: They disposed troops along the river.
